p:
Middle East Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus (MERS-CoV) emerged as a global health concern in 2012 when the first human case was documented in Saudi Arabia
1 . Now listed as one of the WHO Research and Development Blueprint priority pathogens, cases have been reported in 27 countries across four continents
2 . Imported cases into non-endemic countries such as France, Great Britain, the United States, and South Korea have caused secondary cases
3– 5 , thus highlighting the potential for MERS-CoV to spread far beyond the countries where index cases originate. Reports in animals suggest that viral circulation could be far more widespread than suggested by human cases alone
6– 8 .
